text: here's a surprise moss don't just flap
their wings to take off they jump
researchers at Cambridge University used
high-speed video to analyze the takeoffs
of 58 different kinds of moth all of the
moths use their middle and hind legs
unlike most insects which use only one
pair but they have three different
strategies in one the moth depends
entirely on the legs to get airborne in
another the moth uses the legs to jump
but opens the wings right away just a
few milliseconds later in the third the
moth opens its wings right away and uses
both wings and legs to power the takeoff
lighter moths tend to depend more on
their legs heavier moths on their wings
the researchers did not test really big
moths they probably get very little
oomph from their legs and depend almost
entirely on their wings
you
